title: American_Top_40_1984_March_31st
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This rebroadcast is one of many I have recorded from internet radio. A few are incomplete but most are not and I hope you enjoy these as much as I do.

In this broadcast:

This is a Michael Jackson themed countdown. Wierd Al parodies "Beat It" with his song at number 14, Michael sings back-up on Rockwell's song at number 2, and the king of pop is on the chart himself at number 15.

Casey tells how the band Blondie got its name, and how Tracey Ullman got a recording contract.

Casey answers the question, "How many top 40 hits have named dogs in their titles?" Casey says twelve but doesn't stop there.

Casey lists three of the most prominent New Zelanders to make the American charts.

LW#1: Jump - Van Halen
